study_plan_entry.title: PowerMEMS: Power generation and energy conversion based on microsystems technology

free_text.Learning outcomes: Demand for micro power sources is expected to increase significantly with the widespread and growing use of compact information and communication devices with many advanced features. Application of micro- and nanotechnology to the development of distributed, scaled micro-power systems, PowerMEMS, will produce systems that hopefully save energy and preserve the environment. [br/]The course will cover the main aspects related to application of micro and nanotechnology for generation of power and energy conversion with a strong focus on energy harvesting and scavenging. The student will acquire knowledge on the benefits of micro and nanotechnology for power generation and energy conversion, on the main types of PowerMEMS devices and on the maturity of these different technologies. The student will be able to identify the limitations, challenges and opportunities related to the field.   [br/]
free_text.Content: The course will give an overview of the different technologies and principles applied in the field. For the different technologies addressed, the related fundamentals, modelling, designs, microfabrication processes, will be presented. Examples of technologies that will be addressed include micro-fuel cells, micro heat engines, micro-thrusters, thermal and mechanical energy scavengers. Students will participate by developing in the form of an oral presentation a particular application related to the use of PowerMEMS devices.
free_text.Keywords: Power generation, energy harvesting and scavenging, micro-power sources, micro-engines, micro-thrusters, micro fuel-cells, microsystems
free_text.Required prior knowledge: An introduction to microsensors, microfabrication and/or Microsystems technology is recommended
